required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incidental Cancer in Gallbladder Surgical Specimens Focus on Elderly Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Incidental Cancer in Gallbladder Surgical Specimens Focus on Elderly Patients, Retrospective Analysis of 2389 Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Dr. Ersin Arslan Education and Training Hospital

clinical_study.source: Dr. Ersin Arslan Education and Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Causes such as long-term stones and polyp are thought to play a role in the etiology of gallbladder cancer. The routine histopathological examination provides the detection of incidental gallbladder cancers. It should be remembered that acute or chronic cholecystitis accompanied by the thicked wall and a prolonged history of gallstones may be the cause of malignancy, especially in elderly patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators aimed to incidental gallbladder cancer and compare other pathology results with elderly patients.

intervention.description: Incidental gallbladder cancer and other pathology

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent cholecystectomy between January 2016 and February 2020 at our hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acute cholecystectomy
- elective cholecystectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- lack of data
- incidental cholecystectomy,
- cholecystectomy secondary to trauma
- cholecystectomy secondary to malignancy

overall_official.affiliation: Dr. Ersin Arslan Training and Resource Hospital

facility.name: Dr. Ersin Arslan Training and Resource Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Dr. Ersin Arslan Education and Training Hospital
